summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing a request from defense counsel in the Tartaglione case to review attorney visit logs and count slips related to Jeffrey Epstein. The email concerns a protective order and the logistics of providing the documents without violating it.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: A defendant in a case where defense counsel is requesting attorney visit logs and count slips, which are also related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Judge Karas
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge who may need to modify a protective order to allow a firewall counsel to receive documents.

connections.description: Judge Karas is presiding over or involved in the legal case concerning Tartaglione, as a modification to his protective order is being considered.

events.title: Request for Epstein-related visit logs
events.description: Defense counsel in the Tartaglione case requests to see attorney visit logs and count slips that have Tartaglione's name on them, which are also related to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 300 Quarropas Street, White Plains, New York 10601
keyFacts: Defense counsel in the Tartaglione case requested attorney visit logs and count slips related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The documents are potentially covered by a protective order, requiring a firewall counsel to handle them.
A judge, Karas, may need to modify the protective order to allow the documents to be received.
The communication is from the Deputy Chief of the White Plains Division of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY.
The email highlights procedural safeguards (firewall counsel) to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive documents.
